pullRequest.title: Add ElevationFacet and SurfacesFacet to replace SurfaceHeightFacet.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Split the SurfaceHeightFacet in two, the ElevationFacet which has a single height for each (x,z) position, and should be used for generally getting the height above or below ground for things like ore and cave generation, and the SurfacesFacet, which may contain multiple heights per column, and should be used for placing things directly on the surface.
The SurfaceHeightFacet itself is left in, but deprecated, so that modules don't have to transition all at once, and two facet providers are included to convert back and forth between the old and the new style. These should all be removed once all of the relevant modules have been changed.
This doesn't make an immediate difference to world generation, but it is a necessary step towards better support for things like overhangs, floating islands and nicer cave entrances. This PR does not require any modules to be updated in order to not break, but it will be required by some module PRs.
In order to test, you can check that:

on its own, this PR doesn't break world generation
with Terasology/CoreWorlds#13, it still doesn't break world generation
with Terasology/CoreWorlds#13 and Terasology/Caves#10, grass and plants are added to cave entrances, without making the soil there any deeper.

commit.message:
Add ElevationFacet and SurfacesFacet to replace SurfaceHeightFacet.

Split the SurfaceHeightFacet in two, with each part to be used for
somewhat different purposes, to improve the flexibility of the
world generator, particularly regarding multiple surfaces in the
same vertical column (e.g. overhangs). Leave SurfaceHeightFacet
present but deprecated, so that modules don't have to all transition
at once.

nodes.bodyText: You could {@link SurfacesFacet} here to create cross references (not that anybody is actually looking at the generated Javadoc, but anyways...)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2014 MovingBlocks

+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.

+package org.terasology.world.generation.facets;
+
+import org.terasology.math.Region3i;
+import org.terasology.world.generation.Border3D;
+import org.terasology.world.generation.facets.base.BaseFieldFacet2D;
+
+/**
+ * This facet represents the approximate height of the conceptual surface of the ground at each position.
+ * It may exclude local features such as caves. It is intended to be used to determine the altitude relative
+ * to the ground of features that are not placed directly on the surface, such as placing ores at a certain
+ * depth below ground.
+ *
+ * The combination of the SurfacesFacet and the ElevationFacet is a more flexible alternative to the SurfaceHeightFacet.

nodes.bodyText: A part of me wants to go for a more "functional" solution, but then computing the distance each and every time in a custom comparator is also awkward...
Would it in general help if the column of values would be sorted?

commit.message: chore: cross reference SurfacesFacet and SurfaceHeightFacet
